botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts toxic by ingestion and may irritate skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Daphne can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs with small, usually very fragrant tubular, 4-lobed flowers, often followed by colourful berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in moderately fertile, humus-rich well-drained but not dry soil. Mulch to keep roots cool. Prefers slightly acid to slightly alkaline soil in full sun. Resents transplanting
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed in containers in a cold frame as soon as ripe. Insert softwood cuttings in early to mid-summer, and semi-ripe and evergreen cuttings in mid or late summer. Graft in winter or layer in spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 1 or pruning group 8, keep pruning to a minimum
how_to_grow.pests: Young growth may be affected by aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: For leaf spot problems see leaf damage on woody plants; grey moulds and virus diseases may be troublesome
